title: Want to trade for raw commons, Good or better--
author: dougscats

posts.post_title: Want to trade for raw commons, Good or better--
posts.post_content:
I am at the point that I'm collecting all different backs, ungraded, in Good or better condition.  I also collect back-stamps, all off-backs, and SC 460/25's in particular.

So I'm offering the duplicates below for trade.  I do have literally hundreds more in my collection that I'd be willing to trade for cards I desire.
Not thinking of selling at this time, but will consider offers.

Ungraded, with my unofficial, estimated grade:

WHEAT, SC460/42,
JENNINGS, one hand, SC 460/42 OP, G,

McQuillan, SC350/30,
Killian portrait, Piedmont 350/25, Back-stamp: GWT
Dorner, Piedmont 350/25,
Bell, follow through, SC460/30, G,
Donlin batting, SC 350/30, Fair,
Elberfeld, SC460/25, G-VG,
Bell, follow through, SC460/30, G-VG, faint, partial name on top
Ball, Clev, hands at chest, SC 460/25, Poor,
Hoffman, St. L, SC 350/30, F-G,
Konetchy fielding, SC 460/25, G,

GRIFFITH batting, Piedmont 350/25, Poor, specks of paper-loss on back.
McGraw, finger, SC150/25, good beater

Donovan portrait, Old Mill, presents well, but I'd say trimmed on top,
Hoffman, Providence, Polar Bear, [G, I suspect top border could be trimmed],
Murphy batting SC 460/25, G-VG, [measures short]
Jones, St.L., SC 150/30 [Uneven cut on bottom border.  I think it's trimmed].
Bay, Piedmont 350/25 [SL], has clipped corners, no apparent creases,
Schlei batting, Old Mill [measures short].

Note on scans: As the page turns, the backs are in opposite order.

Here's a list of Graded cards available for trade:

SC 350-460/25:
Bergen catching, SGC 40,
Lake, StL, ball in hand, SGC 40,
McGraw, portrait, with cap, SGC 40,
Red Murray, portrait, SGC 20,
Herzog, in sweater, PSA 3,
Stovall batting, SGC 20,
Kleinow, Catching, Bos, PSA 2 [Mk--"INSURGENT 9" back-stamp. Boston/SP]
Schlei batting, SGC 55.

Lefty Leifeld, striped sleeves, Old Mill, PSA 1
